alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Henry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 7:49AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Benton, northern Carroll and southeastern Henry Counties through 830 AM CST... At 749 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Vale, or 10 miles south of Paris, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paris, McKenzie, Huntingdon, Camden, Bruceton, Vale, Springville, Trezevant, Hollow Rock, Big Sandy, McLemoresville, Mansfield, Old Springville, Sunnyside, Ephesus, New Zion, Haigler Ridge, Manleyville, Hico and Van Dyke. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CST for western Tennessee.
